
Intercepted messages use RSA with a modulus that's the product of two Blum primes. Can you exploit this to decrypt the secret? Ciphertext: 5912812414069685348690642388156159187515840069921896035852531501722548416009714825881812708759966144670157989341522037738457280996562563111277048014959644


The flag format is flag{...}
n=5998643846410506978090100797164788373292104640025181989727066482995090922490429263226164221334409575456660892090449291427064484058512603894220390461004869, e=3034609031070581797886135557536503748131749435170159641859747932438067596181429225718135899338982010247339626030724772064768387088673331628679706039459127
The lower 104 bits of p are: 70125842846378464585577960133713777483


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{z0e2rtdu}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5912812414069685348690642388156159187515840069921896035852531501722548416009714825881812708759966144670157989341522037738457280996562563111277048014959644
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5998643846410506978090100797164788373292104640025181989727066482995090922490429263226164221334409575456660892090449291427064484058512603894220390461004869, e=3034609031070581797886135557536503748131749435170159641859747932438067596181429225718135899338982010247339626030724772064768387088673331628679706039459127
The lower 104 bits of p are: 70125842846378464585577960133713777483

extra_info: p=68303641199791682522837383036112836400281782951686749389014653626084428141387, q=87823192746989337429927818493042288556573937233397386625102893665815694656687, Ï†(n)=5998643846410506978090100797164788373292104640025181989727066482995090922490273136392217440314456810255131736965492435706879399922498486346928490338206796
